profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Killingly, Windham County, Conn., November 17, 1757; during the Revolutionary War served as ensign and later as lieutenant in the Fourth (Second Rensselaerwyck Battalion) Regiment, Albany County Militia; justice of the peace in 1791; town clerk in 1791 and 1797; member of the State assembly in 1794, 1795, 1797, 1798 and 1801; appointed brigadier general of militia March 22, 1806; supervisor of the town of Stephentown 1806-1809; sheriff of Rensselaer County 1810-1811; elected as a Federalist to the Thirteenth and Fourteenth Congresses (March 4, 1813-March 3, 1817); member of the board of managers of the Rensselaer County Bible Society in 1815; died in Stephentown, N.Y., August 31, 1825; interment in Old Presbyterian Cemetery on ``Presbyterian Hill,'' at Garfield, in the town of Stephentown, N.Y.

researchRecord.name: In the Peter Van Schaack Papers, 1776-1841, 53 items.
In the Albert Phelps Collection, 1791-1838, 268 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Hosea Moffitt, Stephentown contain letters, deeds, wills, contracts, pension records, bills, and receipts, 1791-1838. Several of the letters concern Hosea Moffitt's role in a dispute among members of the Presbyterian Church. Also included are legal documents of Stephen Van Rensselaer and other local residents.
